metadata.Title: CVE-2022-47938 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - medium.
metadata.Description:
An issue was discovered in ksmbd in the Linux kernel 5.15 through 5.19 before 5.19.2. fs/ksmbd/smb2misc.c has an out-of-bounds read and OOPS for SMB2_TREE_CONNECT.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-47938` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.15.0-1001-aws - 4.15.0-1001.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-5.4.0-1018-aws - 5.4.0-1018.18~18.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1082-azure - 4.15.0-1082.92
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

notes.Note: sbeattie> needs ksmbd-tools installed to enable the service, which is not installed by default.

criterions.comment: linux-aws package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1001.1').
linux-aws-5.0: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'superseded by linux-aws-5.3').
